companions_schism_clocks.description: Tracks the Tradition vs New Way schism arc and the Silver Hand's assault preparation in the Phase 4 Companions storyline.

companions_schism_tradition_vs_newway.name: Tradition vs New Way
companions_schism_tradition_vs_newway.description: Tracks the ideological split between the Circle's Tradition faction (Skjor, Aela) and the New Way / Purity faction (Kodlak, Vilkas, Farkas). Completion triggers companions_schism_breakpoint automatically.
companions_schism_tradition_vs_newway.completion_effect: Schism breakpoint fires; if PC has not chosen a side, faction civil war branch triggers.
advancement_triggers: Public humiliation of one faction by the other (+1)
Whelp actively recruited to a faction (+1 per recruitment, max 2)
Elder ultimatum issued (Kodlak or Skjor draws a line) (+1)
setback_triggers: PC successfully mediates a schism scene (-1)
Shared threat (Silver Hand cell uncovered) momentarily unites factions (-1)
story_hooks: At 2/6: Whelps notice the tension; Ria and Torvar take sides quietly.
At 4/6: Skjor publicly challenges the New Way in the Grand Hall.
At 6/6: Breakpoint triggers — hall-moot called immediately.

companions_whelps_polarization.name: Whelps Polarization
companions_whelps_polarization.description: Tracks how many whelps have been forced to choose a side in the schism. Completion means the whelps have formed two camps and a mini civil war among recruits becomes likely.
companions_whelps_polarization.completion_effect: Sets whelps_polarized=true; increases likelihood of internal_civil_war at breakpoint; reduces Jorrvaskr defense pool by 1 if assault occurs.
advancement_triggers: Athis commits to Tradition or New Way (+1)
Ria commits to Tradition or New Way (+1)
Torvar commits to Tradition or New Way (+1)
Njada Stonearm commits to Tradition or New Way (+1)
setback_triggers: PC bonds with a whelp and convinces them to stay neutral (-1)
story_hooks: At 2/4: Athis and Njada stop eating together; the hall is split at the tables.
At 4/4: Ria confronts Torvar over his choice; a fistfight breaks out in the yard.

silver_hand_assault_preparation.name: Silver Hand: Assault Preparation
silver_hand_assault_preparation.description: Tracks how ready the Silver Hand is to launch their assault on Jorrvaskr. Reaching 6/6 triggers companions_jorvaskr_assault as a staged event. Can be reduced by destroying cells and containing intel leaks.
silver_hand_assault_preparation.completion_effect: companions_jorvaskr_assault triggers immediately. If already in companions_silver_hand_endgame, the assault begins mid-quest.
advancement_triggers: Silver Hand cell left alive after companions_silver_hand_intel (+1 per cell, max 2)
Public werewolf incident implicating the Companions (+1)
Stealth or information-containment failure during intel phase (+1)
Skjor killed at Gallows Rock (Silver Hand emboldened) (+1)
Internal civil war flag set (Silver Hand exploits the division) (+1)
setback_triggers: Silver Hand cell destroyed during intel phase (-1 per cell)
Sympathizer inside Whiterun exposed and removed (-1)
Gallows Rock fully cleared and commander killed (-2)
All cells wiped during endgame (clock resets to 0, assault skipped)
story_hooks: At 2/6: A Silver Hand scout is spotted near Whiterun's gates.
At 4/6: Eorlund Gray-Mane reports that someone has been asking about the Skyforge layout.
At 5/6: A Companions whelp is found beaten outside the city; Silver Hand warning attached.
silver_hand_assault_preparation.gm_notes: This clock is the key pacing lever for Phase 4. A cautious, thorough group can reduce it to 0 and skip the assault entirely. A reckless group or one that ignores intel will force the assault. Either outcome is valid.
